title: (x) Harper's Magazine - Goudy Old Style {Chesh}
content:
I don't have a scan handy, but does anyone know off-hand the primary head and body text fonts used in Harper's Magazine (also, their new sans-serif caption font, if possible -- looks kind of like Cronos)?   
   
I'll see if I can get a scan if no one remembers off the bat.
author: finn

comments.content: The major heads are some form of Caslon. The smaller heads and body text appear to be Goudy Oldstyle. I just happened to have a copy of the mag here. This issue is from July 2003, though, so I don't know about the new caption font. Paul Ford of [Ftrain](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111093119/http:/www.ftrain.com/) just did their new website, so if he can't tell you, he knows who can.

That was obvious, I guess.   
   
I feel kinda dumb now.
